description: To carry out tree surgery - crown thin of 40% and reduction of height to 15m One Oak at T42 within TPO 7
decision_conditions: The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
The mature Oak tree is situated in the side garden area of this property. It is fully visible from the
road and neighbouring park. The tree is in good condition contributing to its high amenity value of
the Area of Special Local Character.
The specification of work will result in multiple pruning wounds that would result in the tree being
vulnerable to pathogens. This would be detrimental to the health of the tree and therefore the
amenity value that it gives. The type of pruning requested could result in 'lions tailing' of branches
causing the tree to become vulnerable when windblown.
There is not sufficient arboriculture reasoning to allow this specification as there is not currently any
visible signs that the tree is not structurally sound.
This work is unjustified and will have a negative impact on the health of the tree and the amenity
